chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M. Kasten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Theft-False Representation >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $5,000.00 and restitution surcharge.

Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-----------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before 10/14/2016 at 8:00 a.m. with work release privileges.  Jail time may be served in Jefferson County under electronic monitoring if the defendant is found eligible.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $5,000.00 and restitution surcharge. 
------------------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
------------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
------------------------------------------

In Court file
BOND QUASHED

2:17 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Lisa M. Kasten in court with Atty Stephen M Compton.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  Parties do not have an agreement.  
2:18 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Donohoo.  
Exhibit #1 marked and identified as photos.  
2:23 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Compton.  
2:25 pm  Statement by Defendant.  
2:29 pm  Court will return at 2:40 pm  
2:39 pm  Court in session.  
Court procees with makes its record and sentencing the deft.  

SENTENCE WITHHELD - 4 years probation  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
1)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
2)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
3)  No contact with the victim.  
4)  Pay restitution in the amount of $5,000.00  
5)  Thirty (30) days in the Walworth County Jail with work release privileges to commence on or before October 14, 2016.  Jail time may be served in Jefferson County under electric monitoring if the deft is found to be eligible.  

No dead time credit   
Court gives warnings as to firearms and voting restrictions  

2:42 pm  Court in recess.
**Transcript filed on 12-12-2016**  (ls)
Verdict No. 1 - Guilty
Verdict No. 3 - Guilty

records.addlTxt:
8:17 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Lisa M. Kasten in court with attorney Stephen M Compton.  
BAILIFFS:  Robert Nitka, George Clettenberg and Verlice Dumas
Court did receive the Jury Instructions that Atty Leusink e-mailed to the Clerk.  
Discussion concerning Instructions and Verdicts.  
8:21 am  Court in recess until 8:30 am  
8:30 am  Court in session.  Jury seated in courtroom.  
8:30 am  Alternate Juror - #109 - is excused at this time.  
8:31 am  Court Instructs the Jury.  
8:49 am  Closing argument by Atty Leusink.  
9:16 am  Closing argument by Atty Compton.  
9:39 am  Rebuttal argument by Atty Leusink.  
9:45 am  Court gives final Instructions and reads verdict forms.  
9:49 am  Clerk gives Oath to Bailiffs.  
9:50 am  Jurors excused from courtroom to begin deliberations.  
9:50 am  No objections by Attys to the reading of the instructions.  
9:50 am  Court in recess.  
10:17 am  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  Jurors are requesting Exhibits 2, 3, 4 and 7.  Attys have no objection to these exhibits going back.  
10:18 am  Court in recess.  
10:53 am  Court in session with Jury seated in courtroom.  Jury has reached a verdict.  
10:54 am  Court reads verdicts.   Jury finds Deft Guilty of Counts #1 and #2.  Value of property was more than $2500.00
10:55 am  Clerk polls the Jurors.  
10:56 am  Court thanks Jurors for their service.  Jurors are excused.  
10:56 am  Court takes short recess to answer any questions Jurors may have.  
11:03 am  Atty Leusink moves for judgment on verdicts.  Atty Compton is not making any motions.  Court enters judgment of conviction on the 2 counts.  Court does not see a need for a PSI.  Court schedules sentencing hearing.  
11:05 am  Court in recess.  
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
**Transcript filed on 11-28-2016**  (ls)

ADDRESS INFO for Lisa M. Kasten
Current: 1153 Boughton Ave, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 06-28-2016)
Prior: W3550 Hwy 18, Helenville, WI 53137 United States
Random Listing Report
Seating for 13
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Voir Dire
Voir Dire List

8:31 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Lisa M. Kasten in court with Atty Stephen M Compton.  
JURY BAILIFFS:  Robert Nitka and George Clettenberg
Atty Leusink makes a record that Jason Kasten is a potential witness and has ** prior convictions.  Atty Compton does agree with this number. 
Court makes a record as to an e-mail received from Atty Schwantes with regard to appointment of counsel for Mr. Jason Kasten.  
Attorney Leusink does not plan on calling Mr. Kasten as a witness at this time although there's a possibility the State could call him.  Attorney Compton indicates he does expect to call him as a witness.    
Atty Compton moves to exclude any evidence regarding Go fund me page created in June of 2014 .
Court hears argument of Attorneys.  
Court does not believe it is an other act but will hear argument (Sullivan analysis)
Court reviews paperwork submitted by Atty Compton with regard to Go Fund Me page.  
Court finds that probative value is not substantially outweighed by the prejudicial effect.  
8:46 am  Court goes off record to discuss witnesses to be called and victim's need for an interpreter.  
8:52 am  OFF COURT RECORD:  Clerk takes roll call of Jurors in the Jury Assembly Room.  Oath of Competency given to Jurors by Clerk.  Jurors are brought up to Courtroom by Bailiffs.  Clerk seats 23 jurors in jury box.  

9:12 am  Court in session.  Court explains process of voir dire.  Case called.  Charges read.  
9:15 am  Attys introduce themselves and witnesses they may call.  
9:16 am  Voir dire by Court.  
9:21 am  Voir dire by Atty Leusink.  
9:33 am  Voir dire by Atty Compton.  
9:36 am  Court in recess.  

9:46 am  Court in session.  
9:47 am  Court makes record that Juror is 3389 is being excused.  
9:47 am  Continued voir dire by Atty Compton.  
10:03 am  Attys take peremptory strikes.  
10:11 am  Clerk reads names of Jurors who have been struck.  
10:12 am  Jurors who were not selected are excused.  
10:14 am  Clerk sweats in jurors.  
10:14 am  Court reads preliminary jury instructions.  
10:17 am  Jurors excused from courtroom for 20 minute recess.  
10:19 am  Attys are satisfied with Jury Panel.  Atty Leusink requests exclusion of witnesses other than his Court Officer and the Victim.  Atty Compton has no objection.  Court asks that Atty Compton advise his witness.  
10:20 am  Court in recess.  

10:40 am  Court in session with Jury seated in courtroom.  
10:41 am  Court reads additional jury instructions.  
10:42 am  Opening statement by Atty Leusink.  
10:59 am  Opening statement by Atty Compton.  

11:16 am  Jane Wilson is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Leusink.  
Exhibit 2 - Copies of checks.  
11:20 am  Cross exam by Atty Compton.  
Exhibit 3 - Copy of backs of checks.  
Exhibits 2 and 3 are offered by Atty Compton, received and published.  
11:32 am  Witness excused.  

11:33 am  Saul Arteaga is sworn as Interpreter for witness.  
11:35 am  Eva Aranda is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Leusink.  
Exhibit 4 - Copy of previously cashed check of Lisa Kasten.  
Exhibit 4 is offered, received and published.  
Exhibits 5 and 6 are marked and identified letters that business received from the bank.  
11:54 pm  Court takes lunch break and asks Jurors to return at 1:00 pm.  
11:55 pm  Court in recess.  

1:00 pm  Court in session with Jury seated in courtroom.  
1:01 pm  Cross exam of Eva Aranda by Atty Compton.  
1:12 pm  Atty Compton has no further questions.  
1:13 pm  Atty Leusink has no further questions but may call her later

1:13 pm  Det. Ben Lindsey is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Leusink.  
Exhibit #1 is marked an identified a DVD contained a recorded interview with Lisa Kasten.
Exhibit #1 is offered and received.  
1:24 pm  Portions of the Interview with Ms. Kasten are played for the Jury.  

2:10 pm  Continued direct exam of Det. Lindsey by Atty Leusink.  
2:11 pm  Cross exam by Attorney Compton.  
Exhibit 7 marked and identified as copy of Go Fund Me page.  
Exhibit 8 marked and identified as cover pages to an Incident Report

2:26 pm  Jury excused from Courtroom.  
2:26 pm  Atty Compton makes record with regard to Officer Winger.  
2:28 pm  Response by Atty Leusink that the State did notify Atty Compton as to the issues with Officer Winger.  
2:29 pm  Det. Lindsey makes offer of proof regarding Officer Winger in response to Court's question.  
2:31 pm  Atty Compton does not have anything further.  
2:31 pm  Court takes recess and will resume at 2:45 pm

2:46 pm  Court in session with Jury seated in courtroom.  
2:46 pm  Court advises Jury that it has sustained the objection of the State.  
2:47 pm  Continued cross exam of Det.Lindsey by Atty Compton.  
2:52 pm  Jury excused from courtroom.  

2:53 pm  Discussion between Court and Attys with regard to State's objection.  Court will allow the questions.  
2:55 pm  Jury seated in Courtroom.  Court advises that State's objection has been overruled.  
2:56 pm  Continued cross of Det. Lindsey by Atty Compton.  
2:57 pm  Redirect by Atty Leusink.  
2:59 pm  Recross by Atty Compton.  
3:00 pm  State rests subject to receipt of all of its Exhibits.
3:01 pm  Atty Compton moves Exhibits 7 and 8 into evidence.  Court receives Exhibits 7 and 8.  Atty Compton moves to withdraw Exhibit 9.  Exhibit 9 is withdrawn.  
3:02 pm  Attorney Compton wishes to be heard outside the presence of the Jury.  Jury excused from courtroom.  

3:02 pm  Atty Compton moves for a directed verdict on Count #1.  
3:03 pm  Court makes record and denies the Motion.  
3:04 pm  Court asks that Mr. Kasten be brought into court with his Counsel so that an offer of proof can be made at this time.  
3:06 pm  Court in recess while we wait for Atty Hammock to be located.  

3:28 pm  Court in session with ATtorneys and the Defendant.  Jason Kasten and Atty Hammock are present in the Courtroom.  Atty Hammock indicates he does intend to invoke his 5th Amendment right.  
3:30 pm  Jason Kasten is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Compton as an offer of proof.  Discussion concerning relevance of question asked concerning Mr. Kasten's criminal record.  
3:33 pm  Court has colloquy with Lisa Kasten as to her constitutional right to testify or to not testify.  Response by Atty Compton to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant's decision to testify has been made freely, knowingly and intelligently.  
3:35 pm  ADA Donohoo is now present in Court and has additional information with regard to a defendant invoking 5th Amendment.  
3:38 pm  Court takes recess to allow Atty Donohoo to find appropriate Jury Instruction.  

3:45 pm  Court back on regard with Attys and Deft.  Parties have reviewed Wis. Stat. s. 905.13.  Discussion between Court and Attys.  
3:48 pm  Court in recess and will resume at 4:00 pm  

4:00 pm  Court in session with Jury seated in courtroom.  
4:01 pm  Lisa Kasten is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Compton.   
4:20 pm  Cross exam by Atty Leusink.  
4:28 pm  Redirect by Atty Compton.  
4:29 pm  Witness excused.  Defense rests.  State has no rebuttal witnesses.  
4:29 pm  Court explains they will be released now and asked to return tomorrow at 8:30 am
4:30 pm  Jurors excused.  
4:30 pm  Attorney Compton renews Motion to Dismiss Count #1;  Court denies motion.  
4:31 pm  Court is recess.  COURT GOES OFF RECORD TO DISCUSS JURY INSTRUCTIONS WITH ATTORNEYS.  Court asks parties to be in Court at 8:15 am tomorrow.  
**Transcript filed on 12-12-2016**  (ls)

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
Matthew Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin
Defendant Lisa M. Kasten in court with attorney Stephen M Compton
Matter is before the Court for final pre-trial.  
Atty Compton advises that he is prepared to proceed to trial on Monday and has no pre-trial issues.  
Atty Donohoo is not available to try this case on Monday so Atty Leusink will be trying this case.  Atty Leusink reports there is one issue.  The victim in count #1 is based in Silver Spring, Maryland and the State would not  be able to proceed on that count if they can't get a representative from the Company to be here on Monday.  If a representative is available, the State would make the necessary arrangements for transportation.  
Attorney Compton would object to any kind of a continuance and would ask that if the victim on Count #1 is not available, that we still proceed to trial on Count #2. 
Court will continue this for a status conference on Friday at 3:00 pm and will allow the defendant to appear by telephone at that time.  
Atty Leusink is to provide Jury Instructions by Friday at noon.  Court asks parties to be present in Court at 8:30 am on Monday and will have Jurors report at 8:15 am
3:22 pm  Court in recess.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.A. OR LAPREFERIDA STORE OR INTERNATIONAL ALOE SCIENCE COUNSEL.
